attributes.action: A & E, Maternity, Stroke services be maintained at the NDDH.
attributes.background:
The NHS have set up a "Success Regime" project for North & East Devon and this has given rise to fears that "red line" services such as
Accident & Emergency, Maternity and Stroke services will be withdrawn from the North Devon District Hospital.

attributes.action: Make Carer's Allowance a qualifying benefit for an NHS Exemption certificate
attributes.background: Carers looking after sick or disabled family members are often unable to work due to their caring responsibilities. Many suffer from health problems themselves due to the stress and physical demands of caring but cannot afford the expense of much needed prescriptions, dental treatment etc.

attributes.action: Keep the Free Movement of People Between the UK and the EU
attributes.background: Britain has voted to leave the EU. Negotiations will soon begin to decide how Britain and the EU go forward over the next few years. We ask that as part of that negotiation, any Prime Minister will ensure that the free movement of people between the UK and the EU will be retained.

attributes.action: Make sure fireworks are silent to reduce stress to pets and wildlife
attributes.background: Every year many thousands of pets and wild animals, get stressed by the ever increasing noise made by fireworks. Several decades ago, fireworks were pretty but quiet. Nowadays, they are incredibly noisy and are often let off at other times of the year, not just in November and New Year's Eve.
attributes.additional_details: The town of Collecchio in Italy, has just passed a law to make fireworks silent, to save stress on pets and wildlife. Every year in the UK (and probably around the world) animals and owners end up in Veterinary centres to get sedatives to help keep their animals safe and with the fireworks "season" now being more year round, this issue is now much greater than it needs to be. Keep fireworks pretty but make them silent.

attributes.action: Create Safe and free HGV parking areas across the country.
attributes.background: There are a large amount of HGV drivers parking in dodgy areas due to there being a lack of suitable free parking areas. This includes in lay-bys and industrial estates. This is putting the drivers, their goods and their vehicles at risk. Other European countries provide free parking. Why can't we?

attributes.action: Make 'may contain' warnings mandatory on food labels.
attributes.background: You're a parent to a child with a severe allergy. You spend time in the shop studying food labels. You give your child something you think is safe. Suddenly their lips, tongue and throat swell. They fight for breath. Lose consciousness. Where's the EpiPen? In their school bag? Quick! QUICK!
attributes.additional_details:
Food producers must show common allergens in the ingredients lists of their products, but if a product 'may contain' allergens due to cross contamination it is the manufacturer who decides whether to detail that on the label.  

For some this could be life threatening, for others it could cause weeks of discomfort. 

We ask that the Food Standards Agency ensure that consumers are made aware when there is genuine potential for traces of common allergens to be present in packaged food.

attributes.action: Withdraw proposals for a devolved East Anglia, i.e. Cambs, Norfolk and Suffolk.
attributes.background: It is fundamentally undemocratic to change the nature of our local democracy without full consultation with the people who will be effected by the proposals. The proposals should be temporarily withdrawn until such time as due consultation and a referendum have been held.
attributes.additional_details:
Where is the accountability, democracy and transparency in these proposals?
Were these proposals put to the people at the 2015 General Election?
What evidence is there that showing the electorate support such changes?

attributes.action: Consider a vote of no confidence in David Cameron
attributes.background: In the light of the recent revelations about the Panama Papers, and his lack of clarity regarding personal involvement, his record on aspects of tax avoidance policy create questions over, for example, his competence at handling such issues.

attributes.action: Extend Coroner jurisdiction to examine unexpected Stillbirth in Labour\Delivery
attributes.background:
There are over 3600 Stillbirths each yr in the UK, with 6-in-10 of these deaths being considered potentially avoidable.

We ask;
- All unexpected Stillbirths during Labour\Delivery are independently reviewed by a Coroner for Inquest
- Local Trusts share Stillbirth statistics with Coroners Office
attributes.additional_details:
'Clara's Law' Campaign has been started following the Inquest of Clara Tully Hardman who was initially classed as Stillborn. During the Inquest several practice, procedural & training issues were identified across various NHS services which prompted changes to limit risk of re-occurrence, thus preventing further tragedies occurring.

Recommendations have been made in the Morecambe Bay Kirkup Report, by Coroners, Pathologists and by Dr Alan Fletcher which recommend reviewing current legislation.

attributes.action: Officially recognise the UK's carers as workers.
attributes.background: The UK's 1.7 Carers save the UK £120 Billion per year, yet they are not afforded any of the rights of normal workers. We seek them to be officially recognised as workers and afforded the rights of Holidays, Sick Pay & Income in-line with the living wage.

attributes.action: Create a national register of individuals banned from keeping animals.
attributes.background: Bans on keeping animals are currently unenforcible as no national register exists.  This petition argues that a national register should be created listing all individuals who have been convicted of animal cruelty and banned from keeping animals.
attributes.additional_details: The current legislation is not fit for purpose.  It is easy for an individual, previously convicted of cruelty to animals, to go out and buy another pet, perpetuating unnecessary suffering and cruelty.  A national register must exist that lists all individuals banned from keeping animals ensuring that their conviction is enforceable, and therefore meaningful.

attributes.action: Law to make all company ownership transparent in UK dependencies & territories
attributes.background: As the Panama Papers prove the British Virgin Islands is one of the world's capitals of tax avoidance, evasion and money laundering. The territory has 600,000 companies registered there with a population of around 30 thousand.
attributes.additional_details:
UK parliament can enforce the following laws or impose direct rule

What would that reform be: All accounts of all companies on public record All beneficial ownership on public record, proven by a requirement that banks confirm the beneficial ownership of companies they provide services to Directorships on public record - 

See more at: http://www.taxresearch.org.uk/Blog/2016/04/05/we-can-change-the-law-in-the-uks-tax-havens-and-impose-direct-rule-if-they-dont-like-it/#sthash.ANKwMayT.FDQP9XFU.dpuf

attributes.action: Stop the planned closure of Children's Centres.
attributes.background: These services are vital for both parents and children. They provide a safe, friendly place for families where friendships are made, important parenting information is learnt, babies have access to toys to aid development. Losing them will cost more in the long run, financially and emotionally.
attributes.additional_details: In my local area of Kettering, Northamptonshire, we currently have seven designated venues spread over the local towns. The proposed cuts will close five of them, reduce one to operating on a part time basis and only one open full time. In an area which is growing hugely with massive new build developments including new family housing and schools. It is unfair for children and parents to miss out on the support these Centres provide. Stop the closures!!

attributes.action: Reopen Crawley hospital A&E
attributes.background: East Surrey hospital is over stretched and we need more hospital space.

attributes.action: Do not exempt universities from Freedom of Information requests
attributes.background: The Higher Education Green Paper contains a proposal to make universities exempt from the Freedom of Information Act, on page 68. This is incredibly dangerous for maintaining transparency and for student media who rely on FOI requests to hold universities and other HEIs to account.
attributes.additional_details:
The Russell Group which represents 24 universities, have publicly supported this proposal: “The additional responsibilities created by FOI represent an unnecessary burden. Furthermore, changes in funding of higher education and the emergence of a private sector of higher education provision mean that continued application of the Freedom of Information Act to universities is unfair.”

It is also corroborated by Universities UK, which represents 132 vice-chancellors and principals.

attributes.action: Turn empty buildings into homeless shelters and housing
attributes.background:
I am Madison and I'm ten.
When I go out with my parents I am sad to see homeless people everywhere I go. They are human beings and it's cold and they deserve a home, a warm bed. It makes me cry because I think it's really unfair.
Then I see all these derelict and empty buildings,  and a solution.
attributes.additional_details:
Why should we have people in our wonderful country with no place to call home?
Why do I get to sleep in a safe and warm home whilst people are out in the cold?
Why are there so many empty houses and buildings if there are poeple who need a roof over their heads?
Why are we not fixing this?

attributes.action: Change of employment law for terminal/long term cancer carers
attributes.background: My husband is diagnosed with terminal cancer. I work full time (need to) and the only options available to me to care for him during treatment and for longer term care are 3 days compassionate leave, unpaid leave or annual leave.
attributes.additional_details: It seems wrong that someone can have maternity leave paid but when your partner is dying you are entitled to next to nothing. Given the number of people who have to work full time in order to keep the family home running during these very difficult times, employment law does not reflect this.  If we are a truly 'caring' nation then it is time this is addressed.

attributes.action: Give all members of the British Armed forces a pay rise equal to politicians.
attributes.background: The people who defend our countries interests are under valued and the job they do is undermined by such a pitiful 1% pay rise. When the government get 11%

attributes.action: Give chimmy a visitors visa so she can visit her mum before she dies.
attributes.background:
My auntie Vera was on BBC news this
Evening because she is currently at pilgrims hospice dying of cancer. Our government is currently refusing a dying woman her last request. Vera's daughter chimmy has been refused a visiting visa just to come and see her mum before she dies.
attributes.additional_details: Our government has continued to take in thousands of immigrants but won't let my auntie who has worked for the NHS for years, paid her taxes and contributed to our community have her last wish. Please sign to try and make her last wish come true ❤️

attributes.action: Lower the legal age of smear tests from 25 to 16
attributes.background: I have seen so many cervical cancer stories from people under the age of 25 and this has resulted in a tragedy. Smear tests would detect any problems related to this and action could be taken, but since the legal age is 25 this cannot be implimented.
attributes.additional_details:
Read further stories at...
http://www.dailymail.co.uk/health/article-2868392/Heartbreak-young-woman-died-cervical-cancer-23-refused-smear-test-managed-buy-family-Christmas-presents-passed-away.htmlway.html
http://www.dailymail.co.uk/health/article-3207991/Mother-24-dies-cervical-cancer-turned-smear-test-young.html
 https://www.cancerresearchuk.org/about-cancer/cancer-chat/thread/im-23-and-denied-a-smear-test

attributes.action: Stop bombing Syria!
attributes.background: At the moment the UK are bombing Syria killing a huge amount of innocent people. There are more efficient methods. Let's help the people of Syria and try and stop these bombings! Please take a few minutes to sign.

attributes.action: Make it easier for younger women to get sterilisation in the UK.
attributes.background: Women are encouraged to wait until they are around 30 before the NHS considers they are sure they want to be child free, in the mean time facing potential problems with various contraception methods and unplanned pregnancy. Please can women be taken more seriously with their child free  choice?

attributes.action: Stop Highway England from sanctioning a Lorry Park at Stanford on the M20
attributes.background: The impact of building a lorry park on the M20 will not solve the problem and will be an environmental disaster. The better way will be to stop lorries from arriving on the M20 through social media and wait at the Haulage Depots until the routes are clear. This solves the problem !
attributes.additional_details: The current proposal is futile and would be an environmental disaster.  It is purely a political solution and will not help in the long term where the estimate in freight traffic over the next 5 years is for an increase of 30%. So then what. Another increase in size to 5000-10000 spaces ?

attributes.action: Keep the right to have elected parent governors on every school's governing body
attributes.background: By law, parent governors currently have reserved seats on a school governing body, allowing parents to engage with management. Without them, Academies will not be answerable to the community for their actions. If your village school sells it's playing field or has poor results you will have no say.
attributes.additional_details:
The Education white paper published March 17th, 2016 states: “We will expect all governing boards to focus on seeking people with the right skills for governance, and so we will no longer require academy trusts to reserve places for elected parents on governing boards.
“We will offer this freedom to all open academies, and as we move towards a system where every school is an academy, fully skills-based governance will become the normal across the education system.”

attributes.action: Demand a second Scottish referendum if the UK votes to leave the EU
attributes.background: If the majority of Scottish voters vote to remain part of the EU but the UK as a whole votes to leave on 23rd June 2016, Scotland, as a europhile country, should have another referendum on independence.

attributes.action: Stop parents of disabled children being fined for all absences during term time.
attributes.background: I have 2 children with autism and anxiety both struggle with crowds and noisy enviroments making it impossible to have a holiday in peek times. My daughters attendance is also poor due to her anxieties  and at times finds it very hard to cope.
attributes.additional_details: It can be very stressful as a parent and we do not need any additional stress or worries  about getting fined, being taken to court or getting a criminal record when we are trying to raise our children to the best of our abilities. There also needs to be clearer guidelines on exceptional circumstances on taking school leave, how can one head of school authorise a leave and another doesn't even though it's exactly the same reason?

attributes.action: Clean Boot Hunting to replace ALL forms of hunting with hounds.
attributes.background: Clean Boot Hunting where bloodhounds pursue a running man rather than a terrified fox is the only humane option & should replace all forms of hunting with hounds. The current ban has been treat with total disregard as hunters are "accidentally" killing foxes as if the ban does not exist.
attributes.additional_details: Drag hunting is not an option as foxes have been known to run into the path of the hounds. We are living in the modern age where 83% of the population are against fox hunting. Changes have to be made and if the hunters still want the thrill of the chase Clean Boot Hunting is the ideal way to replace the "sport" of hunting with hounds. This petition is asking for the end of hunting with hounds and to replace it with Clean Boot Hunting. This is the only way the foxes can be safe.

attributes.action: Guarantee long term funding for the UK's only LGBT domestic violence charity.
attributes.background: Broken Rainbow is the only national charity exclusively working with LGBT victims and survivors of domestic violence. They are currently at risk of closure due to lack of funding security. We want the government to commit to secure and long term funding for this and other specialist DV services.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2015 Broken Rainbow had it's previous 4 year funding renewed for only one year (in which it helped 10k clients) and it has not had new funding confirmed yet. Only funding year by year is short sighted and doesn't allow a charity to plan for the future. The service they provide is completely essential given that: 
-Trans people are often excluded from general DV services.
-There are only 35 refuge beds for men. 
-LGBT survivors have unique needs and issues not met by many general DV services.

attributes.action: Future DWP (Atos) assessments should be carried out by Healthcare Professionals
attributes.background: The current system where a DWP official completes a one-fits-all form for Personal Independent Payments (PIP) and Employment Support Allowance (ESA) is not fit for purpose. This health related assessment should be carried out by Healthcare Professionals that know you and/or know about your illness.

attributes.action: Stronger punishment for mothers who stop fathers seeing their children.
attributes.background: To grow up as a well rounded human being children must have BOTH parents involved in their lives. Unfortunately for many men this is not the reality and they often have to fight through courts. Some often giving up as this can become expensive and at times seem very one sided and never ending.
attributes.additional_details: Implement stricter rules and punishments for mothers who feel this is acceptable. Social services should be involved as this could be seen as not meeting your childrens emotional needs. Court orders should be strongly enforced if they are disregarded by EITHER parent. The system has been unfair and one sided for long enough now and fathers that pose no danger to their children should be able to play an active roll in their lives. I start this petition as a mother, for fathers that are being punished by women that feel children are theirs and theirs only. http://www.lawgazette.co.uk/news/family-courts-have-lost-authority-warns-judge/58240.fullarticle

attributes.action: Assign ADHD/ADD units to primary schools
attributes.background: Children with ADHD/ADD are unable to concentrate in a highly stimulating environment and are suffering academically. Some are even considered a nuisance in the class room and quite commonly called disruptive.  Having their own space with specialist teachers will give them the help they deserve.
attributes.additional_details:
All children have the right to education. In my personal experience and in my job role i have encountered many children with ADHD/ADD that have struggled their whole school life. They go on to secondary and end up being expelled. Their need is high, but is displaced as disruptive or a nuisance.
Schools are yet to accommodate these children.  These children struggle in crowds and then are expected to sit in a classroom of thirty children and focus. They are being let down by the education system

attributes.action: Reform the way voting in elections and referendums is carried out to avoid fraud
attributes.background: Many people in the UK feel that the current system of voting, be it in person or postal, is open to fraud and misrepresentation. With the EU referendum, the London mayoral and local elections happening this year it would help to ease fears of this happening again.
attributes.additional_details: A lot of voters have raised concerns over election fraud so the system needs reviewing. There should be a public record of the vote kept, so people can go back and check their vote has been correctly counted after the result has been announced. ie voter card AB123456A voted leave. Then after the result has been announced the voter with that number can check on the vote list to make sure their correct vote was recorded. I have carefully thought out many options to allow this to be done.

attributes.action: Sufferers of rare cancers to have free access to new cutting edge treatments
attributes.background: Petition The Right Honorable Jeremy Hunt to persuade NICE to allow sufferers of rare cancers to have free access to new cutting edge treatments that are freely available to sufferers of more common cancers, such as Melanoma. My wife Beryl has a very rare Small Cell Carcinoma of the Ovary.
attributes.additional_details: Following 13 cycles of chemotherapy Beryl is now undergoing an experimental course of immunotherapy in the form of "Pembrolizumab".  Had Beryl been suffering from Melanoma she would have been able to access Pembrolizumab for free on the NHS. Although NICE have licensed Pembrolizumab for Melanoma, it is not licensed for her type of cancer. There are not enough sufferers to support a formal trial. We find the decision not to fund Beryl's, and other rare cancer sufferers', care very unjust.

attributes.action: Ban plastic "6 pack rings" and use biodegradable / edible alternatives
attributes.background: Over 100,000 marine animals and 1m sea birds die each year after digesting or getting stuck in plastic "6 pack rings".  I would like government to force manufacturers to use environmentally friendly alternatives / edible (for aquatic life) options.
attributes.additional_details: "6 Pack Ring" refers to the plastic rings used to keep 6 tins or cans of drink together.  As an Island nation we should take the lead to protect our shores and the animals that inhabit them.  A company in the US has developed an edible (to the aquatic life) alternative made using grains from the brewing process.  The rings we use now are photodegradable but can take up to 90 days to break.  Plenty of time to kill a seal, bird, turtle or other marine life that thinks it's something to eat.

attributes.action: Women in the UK must be free to work, travel and live free of sexual violence
attributes.background: Recently, women across the EU were subjected to mass sexual assaults of a type previously unknown in Europe. We demand that Government brings forward proposals for extra measures to uphold UK women's rights, safety & freedom, and to expand police understanding-recognition-response to such behaviour.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.mumsnet.com/Talk/petitions_noticeboard/2550186-Women-in-the-UK-must-be-free-to-work-travel-and-live-free-of-sexual-violence?watched=1
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-europe-35241808
http://www.nytimes.com/2016/01/15/world/europe/as-germany-welcomes-migrantssexual-attacks-in-cologne-point-to-a-new-reality.html?_r=1

attributes.action: Introduce a wildlife conservation points system for all new builds.
attributes.background: Every new build, whether new homes or new commercial builds would have to gain a certain level of points before the building is signed off. I.e 2 points for a hedgehog hole, 2 points for a bird box, points for native planting etc. Points could be doubled if used in the correct scenario.
attributes.additional_details: This would massively help to reduce the decline in many species highlighted by the 'State of Nature report published 3 years ago which reported that 60% of uk species were in decline. This would make a big difference in helping species that now rely on the urban environment such as the hedgehog, swift and house martin to name a few. The cost of the build would be far outweighed by the benefits to wildlife and humans.

attributes.action: To educate parents of the dangers- arrangement of furniture in child's bedroom.
attributes.background: Noah had somehow managed to climb out of his cot and onto the changing table beside it. It is unknown what exactly happened on that fateful morning, but Noah had slipped between the two pieces of furniture and become trapped, causing him to become asphyxiated and sadly die. He was found hanging.
attributes.additional_details:
As Noah's mother, I feel this subject should reach new parents when they attend antenatal and midwife appointments. 
There is so much information out there relating to other risks such as SIDS and bath safety etc, however there seem to be more incidents regarding bedroom furniture and cots as I research further, but not much is being done to make changes or raise awareness.

attributes.action: Spend ALL Surplus National Insurance Payments On The NHS
attributes.background:
Chancellor George Osborne is currently sitting on a £30 BILLION National Insurance surplus. Unable to spend it on anything else and unwilling to spend it on the NHS, he has chosen to let it gather dust while our NHS is desperate need of extra funding. 
.
attributes.additional_details:
National ­Insurance money can only be used for the NHS or benefits. So since he can’t spend it on anything else and chooses not to fund ­hospitals, the Chancellor lets it sit there.

We need a lasting solution to fund a service we all depend on. So let’s fill the black hole and fund a new National Health and Care Service with our own little pot of NHS gold.

It is clear that the Tory government is trying to privatise the NHS through under funding until we have no choice but to privatise.

attributes.action: Create inpatient units in every city for adolescent eating disorder treatment.
attributes.background: Adolescent ED numbers are increasing. EDs are evolving, facilities & provisions are not. Patients are often located hours from home as no local specialised units exist. Given the proven success of family based therapy, this needs to be more accessible to families. More small, local units are needed.
attributes.additional_details: Many families have loved ones in hospital anything from an hour to 5 hours from home. For successful recovery, regular family therapy is vital. People are unable to travel these distances 2-3 times a week. Patients are having increased stays in hospital as a result or simply not recovering. We need more local facilities to aid patient recovery and family intervention & support. Our future generations need and deserve this chance to live.

attributes.action: Lower the wage requirement of British citizens with a non-EU spouse.
attributes.background: Current minimum earning guideline is £18,600. This is unfair to young people starting out, particularly ex-military people.There are many hard working British people with good employment prospects that are being kept from their families because of this hard-fast rule. We propose a level of £14,000.
attributes.additional_details:
Consider that the government gives the guidelines as below:
Living wage is £7.20
Average annual working hours in the UK 1677* x 7.2 = £ 12,074.40
(* Source: 2014 OECD - Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development). £14,000 is a fairer amount.
What also should be considered in the decision are the spouse’s future employment capabilities, e.g. employment and educational background. Another consideration that should be made is the British citizen’s family backing within the UK.

attributes.action: Abolish the "Civil" football ban
attributes.background: How can you ban lads from going to football and take away their passports when they haven't even commited any crime

attributes.action: Implement the Tipping Point declaration as a legal requirement in the UK:
attributes.background: We want every UK hospitality business* to be legally required to complete the Tipping Point Campaign declaration. It must also be made compulsory for a printed copy of the completed declaration to be displayed at each premises and made available on company websites.
attributes.additional_details:
This simple solution offers the transparency long called for by hospitality customers and employees alike so they can make an informed decision as to how they wish to engage with the business.

The proposed Tipping Point Campaign declaration questionnaire: 
www.tippingpointcampaign.org.uk/the-declaration/

*a business whose primary activity is the provision of food, drink and/or hospitality

attributes.action: Include nootropic drugs in the whitelist of the Psychoactive Substances Act 2016
attributes.background:
Nootropic drugs are the class of drugs that increase cognitive and/or intellectual function in users. 

This petition is to whitelist all nootropic drugs that are both non-addictive and relatively safe in that there are no common dangerous side effects and whose therapeutic index is high.

attributes.action: Art50: Wait for a proposal from the EU on reform, before triggering Article 50.
attributes.background:
Art50 Petition: How to tame the Brexit madness.

People in Britain and Europe are angry with their governments. Frexit or Nexit would tear the financial, economic and political fabric of Europe apart, inflicting further damage on people’s lives.

Stop the Brexit madness! Sign the Art50 Petition!
attributes.additional_details:
UK should request EU proposals on:

- Making EU institutions directly accountable to voters
- Improving cooperation where needed, while protecting national sovereignty 
- Creating a dynamic EU economy, with inclusive growth for all citizens
- Concrete steps to stabilize the Euro, while protecting non-Eurozone

Britain shall request no special treatment as part of the reform. 

A second Brexit referendum can be held after EU reform proposals. Only trigger Article 50 after a second Leave vote.

attributes.action: Do not grant funding for a replacement of Trident
attributes.background: Trident is a set of submarines armed with nuclear missiles. They are considered to be "deterrents". The cost for these WMDs have been in the tens of billions. It is now on the table to replace the Trident programme, with something even more expensive. The "cheap" proposal is at 167 billion pounds.
attributes.additional_details:
"The overall cost of replacing and maintaining Britain's nuclear deterrent will reach 167 billion pounds ($256 billion), much more than expected, according to a lawmaker's and Reuters' calculations based on official figures." — http://reut.rs/1UybhEG

It is money that "would be enough to fully fund A&E services for 40 years, employ 150,000 new nurses, build 1.5 million affordable homes, build 30,000 new primary schools, or cover tuition fees for 4 million students." — http://bit.ly/1oY82dU

attributes.action: MAKE FAULTY BIRD NETTING ILLEGAL!
attributes.background:
Wild birds often get trapped in or behind netting put on buildings and under bridges as a deterrent and they suffer long, painful deaths from starvation or strangulation.
Make all netting which is faulty or not fit for purpose ILLEGAL.
If netting cannot be maintained it should be REMOVED.
attributes.additional_details:
Netting often traps birds and therefore they should be easily ACCESSIBLE for rescue. Trapped birds are protected under the 2006 Animal Welfare Act and should be released or handed to wildlife rescuers. Further, ALL wild birds, together with their nests, are protected under the 1981 Wildlife and Countryside Act. It is the responsibility of the owner of the property to ensure compliance with the law. 
There are alternative deterrents which are more humane and effective.

attributes.action: Leave the EU make Britian Independant again. No ECC legislation anymore.
attributes.background: To leave the EU completly and England to be totally Independant once more.
attributes.additional_details: UKIP and the Labour Party have clear guidance on 55.4 million we pay a day to be in the EU =12.4 billion of tax payers money we must leave the EU soon that is the basis of this Debate

attributes.action: Provide accessible mental health services for 18-30 year olds
attributes.background: Adult mental health services tend to cater for the middle-aged and the elderly in our society, not for the young adults who have just come out of CAMHS. Young adults who enter the services are faced with the battle to be properly supported, as the services are not suited to their specific needs.
attributes.additional_details:
As a result of not having a specialist young adults' service, young adults have been left to fend for themselves in a system that doesn't understand them; fighting to be recognised in hospitals which want to care for the middle-aged and elderly; less able to care for themselves due to a lack of proper support; and less likely to seek help with their mental health in the first place.

We ask you to consider putting some of the limited mental health funding towards a service for 18-30 year olds.

attributes.action: Clarify to public the many contributions to education brought by EU membership
attributes.background: Contributions include opportunities for young people to study and work in other EU countries, for teachers to share effective practice, funded project opportunities through Lingua and Erasmus +, support for research enabling major projects to be undertaken, social and cultural links at all levels.
attributes.additional_details: The significant contributions to educational purposes that have been brought by EU membership extend across the curriculum and beyond the education system. The Language Alliance supports this petition; we are a broad-based independent Forum, created in 2002, aiming to bring to the attention of a wider public the importance of language to the development of community understanding and empowerment on a local, national or international level; members attend on a personal basis.

attributes.action: Ban the inport / export sale and use of child like sex dolls in the UK
attributes.background: To what level have we sunk to as human beings to think that it is acceptable in any way or form for a sex doll to be produced and manufactured in the form of a small child to satisfy and pander to the sick and twisted thoughts and cravings of a Paedophile?!!!!
